mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Mary Morris Hamilton to Ann Pamela Cunningham, 1858 August 17
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Schuyler, Mary Morris Hamilton, 1818-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Mary Morris Hamilton, Vice Regent for New York, to Ann Pamela Cunningham, August 17, 1858. Miss Hamilton agrees with the Regent regarding the landscape gardener and that a resident superintendent is more desirable. Association wishes to restore Mount Vernon to Washington's time. Discusses Vice Regents of various states. Will try to send in "returns", but state is not yet canvassed, disappointed state is not more enthusiastic.
